column4: hey guys I am using imwheel to set up hotkeys for the extra functions on my mouse, but when I lock the screen and come back later, the process always loses its tty.  Is there a way to reclaim it?  Or hook a script to the event of unlocking the screen where i could kill/restart it?
don't know, but I can tell you xbindkeys works fine.  imwheel lets you have application-specific binds, but if you aren't doing that then xbindkeys should be fine
lshw will just give you more info, either is fine for what you ask
With xbindkeys, where do you find the right identifiers for inputs?  I don't see keysym.h or keysymdef.h anywhere
doesn't seem to pick up my extra mouse functionality :-/
hard to tell but I don't think so.  Not all that familiar with xev
fwiw, I just use for example "b:4" for my mouse buttons even though xbindkeys -k shows me something more complicated looking
so "b:4" would correspond to "Button 4" in xev?
I'll give it a shot and let you know how it works
one last question...is there a way to bind a key to act as a different key, or can they only launch commands
both :).  Here's an example of what I mean: "/usr/bin/xvkbd -xsendevent -text "\[Control_L]\[Page_Up]" &"
note xvkbd is not installed by default

I keep getting errors with different permutations of using xvkbd; they all result in "xvkbd: Mode_switch not available as a modifier; xvkbd: although ISO_Level3_Shift is used instead, AltGr may not work correctly"
